title-part.text: PRODUCTION OF CELLULOSE BY REMOVING NON-CELLULOSE SUBSTANCES FROM CELLULOSE-CONTAINING MATERIALS

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Pretreatment of the finely-divided materials before digesting

with compounds not otherwise provided for

title-part.text: After-treatment of cellulose pulp, e.g. of wood pulp, or cotton linters

CPC-specific-text.text: ; Treatment of dilute or dewatered pulp or process improvement taking place after obtaining the raw cellulosic material and not provided for elsewhere

reference.text: polysaccharides, derivatives thereof C08B; paper-making D21B - D21H

CPC-specific-text.text: Modification of pulp properties
by chemical means; preparation of dewatered pulp, e.g. in sheet or bulk form, containing special additives
inorganic compounds
organic compounds
by mechanical or physical means
Prevention of corrosion or formation of deposits on pulp-treating equipment
; Displacing cooking or pulp-treating liquors contained in the pulp by fluids, e.g. wash water or other pulp-treating agents
; Washing of pulp of fluid consistency without substantially thickening
; Washing of concentrated pulp, e.g. pulp mats, on filtering surfaces

title-part.text: Removal of fats, resins, pitch or waxes;

CPC-specific-text.text: Chemical or physical purification, i.e. refining, of crude cellulose by removing non-cellulosic contaminants, optionally combined with bleaching

reference.text: fats, waxes C11B; natural resins C09F1/00; hemicellulose C08B37/14; purification by mechanical means D21D5/00

Elimination of cooking or pulp-treating liquors from the pulp

reference.text: D21C9/002, D21C9/02 take precedence; paper-making machines D21F; strainers in digesters D21C7/00; presses in general B30B

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising at least one step where the pulp is suspended in a gaseous medium, e.g. flash drying
or effluent waste waters
Recovery of by-products, i.e. compounds other than those necessary for pulping, for multiple uses or not otherwise provided for

reference.text: volatile compounds obtained by decomposition of spent liquors in order to regenerate them D21C11/125; compounds obtained by fractionating the liquors in order to regenerate them D21C11/0042

CPC-specific-text.text: Combination of various pulping processes with one or several recovery systems (cross-recovery)
Introduction of various effluents, e.g. waste waters, into the pulping, recovery and regeneration cycle (closed-cycle)
Effluents derived from the washing or bleaching plants
Introduction of compounds, e.g. sodium sulfate, into the cycle in order to compensate for the losses of pulping agents
Fractionating or concentration of spent liquors by special methods
Treatment of liquors with ion-exchangers
Oxidation of liquors, e.g. in order to reduce the losses of sulfur compounds, followed by evaporation or combustion if the liquor in question is a black liquor

reference.text: deodorisation of gases D21C11/08; combustion D21C11/12, D21C11/14

CPC-specific-text.text: Aspects concerning the production and the treatment of green and white liquors, e.g. causticizing green liquor

Treatment of green or white liquors with gases, e.g. with carbon dioxide for carbonation; Expulsion of gaseous compounds, e.g. hydrogen sulfide, from these liquors by this treatment (stripping); Optional separation of solid compounds formed in the liquors by this treatment

reference.text: oxidation of liquors (black, green or white) D21C11/0057; treatment of pulp gases D21C11/06

CPC-specific-text.text: Treatment of green or white liquors with other means or other compounds than gases, e.g. in order to separate solid compounds such as sodium chloride and carbonate from these liquors; Further treatment of these compounds

Introduction of auxiliary substances into the regenerating system in order to improve the performance of certain steps of the latter, the presence of these substances being confined to the regeneration cycle

reference.text: introduction of compounds in order to make up for the losses of pulping agents D21C11/0035; conventional causticizing of green liquors D21C11/0064; fractionating of spent liquors D21C11/0042

CPC-specific-text.text: Substances modifying the evaporation, combustion, or thermal decomposition processes of black liquor

reference.text: treatment of solid substances (ash) separated from combustion gases D21C11/066; avoiding scale-forming during evaporation D21C11/106

CPC-specific-text.text: acid, neutral or alkaline

title-part.text: Recovery of the heat content of the gases;

CPC-specific-text.text: Treatment of gases arising from various sources in pulp and paper mills; Regeneration of gaseous SO2, e.g. arising from liquors containing sulfur compounds
Treatment of gas streams comprising solid matter, e.g. the ashes resulting from the combustion of black liquor

reference.text: evaporation of pulp liquors by direct contact with gases D21C11/103; post-combustion of gases D21C11/127

CPC-specific-text.text: Separation of solid compounds from these gases; further treatment of recovered products
Elimination of malodorous compounds, e.g. sulfur compounds such as hydrogen sulfide and mercaptans, from gas streams

reference.text: oxidation of liquors D21C11/0057; post-combustion of gases D21C11/127

CPC-specific-text.text: Evaporation by direct contact with gases, e.g. hot flue gases
Prevention of incrustations on heating surfaces during the concentration, e.g. by elimination of the scale-forming substances contained in the liquors
Treatment, e.g. dissolution, of the smelt
Decomposition of the pulp liquors in reducing atmosphere or in the absence of oxidants, i.e. gasification or pyrolysis
with post-combustion of the gases
; Treatment of pulp liquors without previous evaporation, by oxidation of the liquors remaining at least partially in the liquid phase, e.g. by application or pressure

reference.text: oxidation of black, green or white liquors D21C11/0057
